noun.description: A second or subsequent muster; the action or an instance of remustering.

verb.description: To summon, gather up, or call into play (one's skills, courage, enthusiasm, etc.) again.
To cause (a body of people) to reassemble.
Of a body of people: to reassemble, reform.
To assign (a person) to a different category of duties.
To be assigned to a different category of duties.

origin: Late Middle English. From re- + muster. In later use probably after remuster<br>early 19th century. From re- + muster. Compare remuster.
